s.text: That's been true through most of human history.

4) Social equality: Clinton's defenders--including those ordinary focus-grouping Americans--offend the most when they suggest that a certain latitude in moral and criminal matters goes with the president's exalted position.
America, in this sense, is a conspiracy against human nature--and not just in that we expect monogamy when the rule of history has been polygamy.

Less obviously, Clinton's sin is the same one reporters commit when they denounce Starr for impeding "our ability to gather information for the public"--as if the press were a separate institution with special privileges and (inevitably) obligations, the eyes of the social corpus nobly gathering information on behalf of poor, ignorant citizens.
